intro: Lepidium micropetalum, commonly known as the narrow-petaled cress, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and small, alternate leaves that are usually lanceolate or ovate in shape. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes, and are characterized by their narrow petals. Lepidium micropetalum is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in moist meadows, where it thrives in partial to full sunlight.
